class.name: Shaman
classFeatures: Optional Rule: Alternate Ability Shaman|Shaman|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman

default: (a) a {@item shield|PHB} or (b) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|type=simple weapon=sand|category=basic}
(a) a {@item component pouch|PHB} or (b) an {@item arcane focus|PHB} or {@item druidic focus|PHB}
(a) a {@item explorer's pack|PHB} or (b) an {@item dungeoneer's pack|PHB}

fluff.name: Shaman
entries: Nature is a powerful force containing a myriad of mysterious magics. Shamans have the ability - learned, intuited, or innate - to act as a conduit for that natural magic.
Shamans channel ancient rites in the form of runes, summon elemental spirits, and evoke powerful elemental magic to manipulate their enemies and allies alike.

entries.name: Creating a Shaman
entries: To create a Shaman, consult the subsections which give you hit points, proficiencies, and starting equipment. Then look at the Shaman table to see which features you get at each level. The descriptions of those features appear below.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Shaman quickly with these suggestions: First, put your highest ability score in Wisdom, followed by Constitution or Dexterity; second, choose the Outlander background; third, choose the {@spell Produce Flame|PHB} and {@spell Dancing Lights|PHB} cantrips, along with the 1st-level {@spell Ice Knife|XGE} and {@spell Thunderwave|PHB} spells.

entries.name: Multiclassing and the Shaman
entries: If your group uses the optional rule on multiclassing in the Player's Handbook, here's what you need to know if you choose artificer as one of your classes.

entries.name: Ability Score Minimum
entries: As a multiclass character, you must have at least a Wisdom score of 13 to take a level in this class, or to take a level in another class if you are already a Shaman.

entries.name: Proficiencies Gained
entries: If Shaman isn't your initial class, here are the proficiencies you gain when you take your first level as a Shaman: light armor and simple weapons.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: To determine your available spell slots, you include all of your Shaman levels.

classFeature.name: Optional Rule: Alternate Ability Shaman
entries: While Shamans channel nature's magic in a similar mystical manner to druids, it is also possible to learn this power through study, or through force of will in dedication to nature.
If this is the case for your Shaman, you may prefer to use Intelligence or Charisma instead of Wisdom for your shaman features. If you do so, make the following changes:

items: Wherever you would use Wisdom for your shaman features or specialism features, such as your Spellcasting or Rune features, you instead use your chosen ability.
If you choose Intelligence, you replace Charisma as a saving throw proficiency given by this class with Intelligence.
A multiclassed character would require a 13 in the chosen ability (instead of Wisdom) to take a level in this class, or take a level in another if Shaman is your first class.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: Your experience in nature has infused you with the primordial magics of the world. This could be a life in a tribe, time spent wandering the wilds and finding a spirit, or unexpected communion with a nature deity. Whatever its origin, it fuels your spellcasting. You can channel these primal magics to strike those who would defy nature, restore your allies, and manipulate the world around you.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know two cantrips of your choice from the Shaman spell list. You learn an additional cantrip of your choice at 7th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Shaman table above shows how many spell slots you have to cast your {@filter shaman spells|spells|class=Shaman} of 1st-level or higher. To cast one, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all of your expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the shaman spell list.
You learn an additional Shaman spell of your choice every level, and every other level from level 11 onwards.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Shaman spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Shaman spell list, which must also be a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for Shaman spells as you draw magic from your connection to nature. You use your Wisdom when a Shaman spell refers to your spellcasting ability, and you use your Wisdom modifier whenever you set the saving throw DC or make a spell attack roll for one of your Shaman spells.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a {@item druidic focus|PHB} as a spellcasting focus for your shaman spells. You or your DM may decide it more appropriate to use an {@item arcane focus|PHB}, depending on how your shaman learned their magic.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: Your connection to nature can be channeled with time, at less cost to yourself. You can cast a shaman spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin
entries: At 1st level, you determine the origin of your shaman abilities. This could be the source that they are drawn from, where your Shaman grew up or learned their magic, or the specific location they first unlocked their magical gifts.
This origin grants you features at 1st level, and again at 6th, 10th, and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Primordial Runes
entries: Your access to the primal forces of the world has granted you access to Primordial Runes, fragments of primal spirits which can enhance your own power, grant you new abilities or allow you to conjure totems which grant benefits within an area.

At 2nd level, you gain 2 Primordial Runes of your choice. A list of the available options can be found on the {@filter Optional Features|optionalfeatures|feature type=PRU} page. When you gain certain Shaman levels, you gain additional runes of your choice, as shown in the Runes column of the Shaman table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the runes you know and replace it with another that you could learn at that level.

If a rune has prerequisites, you must meet them to gain that rune. You can gain a rune at the same time you meet its prerequisites. A level prerequisite refers to your level in this class. If you lose the prerequisite for a rune, for example you change your elemental affinity, you may replace it with another rune for which you meet the prerequisite.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity
entries: At 3rd level, your attunement to nature grants you an affinity with a specific element. Choose one of the following:

entries.name: Affinity with Flame
entries: Your chosen element is fire. You gain the {@spell Firebolt|PHB} or {@spell Green-Flame Blade|TCE} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Growing Heat} feature below.

entries.name: Growing Heat
entries: Whenever you deal fire damage to a creature, they take additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus whenever you deal fire damage to them before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Affinity with Frost
entries: Your chosen element is cold. You gain the {@spell Ray of Frost|PHB} or {@spell Frostbite|XGE} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Biting cold} feature below.

entries.name: Biting Cold
entries: Once per round, when you deal cold damage to a creature, that creature suffers a penalty equal to your proficiency bonus to the next attack roll or ability check that it makes before the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Affinity with Lightning
entries: Your chosen element is lightning. You gain the {@spell Crackling Bolt|J:General} or {@spell Shocking Grasp|PHB} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Arc Lightning} feature below.

entries.name: Arc Lightning
entries: Once per round, when you deal lightning damage to a creature, you can arc lightning from one target to another. Up to two different creatures of your choice within 15 feet of the original target take Lightning damage equal to your proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Affinity with Thunder
entries: Your chosen element is thunder. You gain the {@spell Thunderclap|XGE} or {@spell Booming Blade|TCE} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Thundercrack} feature below.

entries.name: Thundercrack
entries: Once per turn, when you deal Thunder damage to a creature, you may move it five feet in a direction of your choice, provided it is large or smaller. Additionally, whenever you deal thunder damage to an object, you maximise the value of the dice instead of rolling damage against that object.

entries.name: Affinity with Acid
entries: Your chosen element is acid. You gain the {@spell Acid Splash|PHB} or {@spell Primal Savagery|XGE} cantrip. Additionally, you gain the {@b Persistent Corrosion} feature below.

entries.name: Persistent Corrosion
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature, you can cause the acid to linger on them. At the start of each of its turns, the creature takes acid damage equal to your proficiency bonus. The acid lasts until a creature uses its action to remove it, or you use this feature again on a different target.
You can change your elemental affinity whenever you gain a level in this class.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity Improvement
entries: At 7th level, your attunement to the elements grows deeper. You become resistant to the damage type of your chosen elemental affinity.

classFeature.name: Primordial Knowledge
entries: Your strong connection to nature allows you access to ancient knowledge and abilities.

items: You gain a bonus to {@skill arcana} and {@skill nature} checks equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.
Additionally, you learn the {@spell Skill Empowerment|XGE} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot. It does not count against the number of Shaman spells you know.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Origin Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your elemental origin.

classFeature.name: Elemental Affinity Improvement
entries: At 17th level, you are a paragon of your chosen element. You become immune to the damage type of your chosen elemental affinity.

classFeature.name: Overload
entries: At 18th level, you gain the ability to briefly push your magical abilities to their limit by experiencing magical feedback.
When you cast a Shaman spell, you can deal the maximum possible damage instead of rolling on the turn that you cast it.
Upon doing so, you take force damage equal to your Shaman level plus the level of the spell cast, which cannot be reduced in any way, and you cannot cast spells until after your next turn.
After you use this ability, you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Spiritual Avatar
entries: At 20th level, you can use a bonus action to channel the spirits of nature directly for one minute, using yourself as a conduit. This might change your appearance as you choose to suit your elemental affinity or origin, such as your head being lit with flames, or your skin being covered with frost.
While this state is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a flying speed of 50 feet.
Whenever you cast a Shaman spell that has a casting time of one action, you can cast it using a bonus action instead.

entries: At this level, you also have access to a Primordial Rune specific to your subclass that can enhance your Spiritual Avatar in another way.
Once you use this feature, you can't do so again until you complete a long rest.

subclass.name: Waters
subclassFeatures: Ebb and Flow Improvement|Shaman|S: Shaman|Waters|S: Shaman|6
Master of the Tides|Shaman|S: Shaman|Waters|S: Shaman|14

subclass.name: Mountains
subclassFeatures: Spirit of the Valley|Shaman|S: Shaman|Mountains|S: Shaman|10
Watcher of the World|Shaman|S: Shaman|Mountains|S: Shaman|14

subclassFeature.name: Waters
entries: Water is often described as the source of life. Shamans of the waters - be that rivers, lakes, or the sea - know this, and control water in order to control life itself. They can manipulate the flow of positive energies in order to manipulate the flow of battle. Using water's restorative magic to assist their allies, and the force of water to throw their enemies off-balance.

subclassFeature.name: Waters Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Waters Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

entries.caption: Waters Shaman Spells
rows: {@spell Freedom of Movement|PHB}, {@spell Aura of Purity|PHB}

subclassFeature.name: Meandering Streams
entries: {@i 1st-level Waters Shaman feature}

Water supplies life in all places, and water flows down mountains and across plains before reaching the sea. This intuitive knowledge of the wider world and its layout grants you proficiency with the {@skill Survival} skill and {@item cartographer's tools|phb}. It would also be reasonable to have waterproof paper or a waterproof pouch to keep your supplies in.
Additionally, you can hold your breath for twice as long as you otherwise could.

subclassFeature.name: Ebb and Flow
entries: {@i 1st-level Waters Shaman feature}

When you restore hit points to a creature, you can use an action or a bonus action to throw a jet of water at an opponent within 30 feet. Make a ranged spell attack: on a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d4} bludgeoning damage and is knocked {@condition Off-balance|S: Conditions}.

subclassFeature.name: Ebb and Flow Improvement
entries: {@i 6th-level Waters Shaman feature}
The damage of the water jet increases to {@damage 2d4} + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Flow As Water
entries: {@i 10th-level Waters Shaman feature}
You can breathe underwater and gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

Furthermore, when a creature hits you with an attack, you can use a reaction to transform briefly into water and move up to your movement speed in any direction without provoking opportunity attacks, and gaining the {@condition Regenerating|S: Conditions} condition with an amount equal to your Shaman level, for one turn.

This movement can move through other creatures' spaces, but if you end your movement in another creature's space you are ejected to the nearest unoccupied space, taking {@damage 1d8} force damage for each 5 feet you are ejected.
You can use this reaction once per short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Master of the Tides
entries: {@i 14th-level Waters Shaman feature}
Your Ebb and Flow has improved to match the very motion of the world itself, in the model of the ocean's tides.

When your water jet hits a target, you can restore hit points equal to the damage dealt to a creature of your choice within 30 feet of the target. The damage of the water jet increases to {@damage 2d8} + your wisdom modifier.
Finally, you can use the water jet without needing to restore hit points to a creature.

subclassFeature.name: Mountains
entries: The mountains are steadfast and towering, watching over the world and earth while being unmovable by any convential means. Shamans of the Mountains inhabit these places, settling on or within the mountains, moving stone, guarding themselves and others, and attuning to nature so as to carry out its will. They are stoic, often living introverted lives in small communities, but do valuable work in maintaining the balance of nature in the harsh climates of the mountains.

subclassFeature.name: Mountains Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Mountains Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

subclassFeature.name: Mountain Home
entries: {@i 1st-level Mountains Shaman feature}

The mountains have stood the test of time, and with that time comes knowledge. You gain proficiency in {@item mason's tools|phb} and have advantage on Intelligence checks made to identify information about or investigate the properties of rooms or objects comprised in some way of stone (for example, the history of a ruin, natural properties of mountains, investigating a stone room).

Furthermore, you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift, and you are naturally adapted to cold climates when considering {@hazard extreme cold|DMG}.

subclassFeature.name: Mountainhide
entries: {@i 1st-level Mountains Shaman feature}
Your skin is toughened by your elemental source. While you are not wearing armour, your AC is 13 plus your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering Spirit
entries: {@i 1st-level Mountains Shaman feature}
You can call on the spirits for active protection when you are in danger. When you take damage, you can use a reaction to reduce that damage by {@dice 1d6} plus your Constitution modifier.
You can do this a number of times per long rest equal to your proficiency bonus, or spend a spell slot of first level or higher to gain an additional use (no action required).

subclassFeature.name: Earthly Attachments
entries: {@i 6th-level Mountains Shaman feature}

You are connected to the earth and ground, and all living things on them. When you see a creature within 30 feet of you take damage, you can channel your {@subclassFeature Unwavering Spirit|Shaman|S: Shaman|Mountains|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman} to protect them instead of yourself, reducing the damage they take.
The damage reduction of your Unwavering Spirit is increased to {@dice 2d6} plus your Constitution modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Unwavering Spirit Improvement
entries: {@i 10th-level Mountains Shaman feature}

The mountains watch over vast swathes of land, as you do, and now your own magic becomes a source of this protection. The damage reduction from your {@subclassFeature Unwavering Spirit|Shaman|S: Shaman|Mountains|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman} increases to {@dice 3d6} plus your Constitution modifier and your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Spirit of the Valley
entries: {@i 10th-level Mountains Shaman feature}

You can call on the chilling winds of the valley. You can use an action to {@condition slowed|S: Conditions|slow} all creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you. Once you do, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
Your experience with mountainous terrain means that you are no longer affected by difficult terrain on surfaces made of stone or rocks, snow, ice, or similar ground.

subclassFeature.name: True Mettle
entries: {@i 14th-level Mountains Shaman feature}

You are a titan of endurance, a bastion for your allies. The damage reduction from your {@subclassFeature Unwavering Spirit|Shaman|S: Shaman|Mountains|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman} increases to {@dice 4d6} plus your Constitution modifier and your Wisdom modifier.

Alternatively, you can now use your unwavering spirit to protect a creature from death. When the target would be reduced to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, you can expend a reaction and use of your unwavering spirit to reduce it to 1 hit point instead.

subclassFeature.name: Watcher of the World
entries: {@i 14th-level Mountains Shaman feature}
You resist even entropy itself. You age ten times slower than similar creatures due to your elemental origin. Each decade that passes causes you to age only one year.

subclassFeature.name: Dunes
entries: The dunes are unforgiving environments - be they hot or cold - and discretion is often the better part of survival. Shamans of the Dunes often live nomadic lifestyles, roving the deserts and ensuring that even such a harsh environment can continue its intended course. They are often reclusive, living within their travelling group, but may forge strong bonds - any survivor knows that surviving is easier done with allies at your side.

entries.subclassFeature: Life in the Dunes|Shaman|S: Shaman|Dunes|S: Shaman|1

subclassFeature.name: Dunes Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Dunes Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

subclassFeature.name: Life in the Dunes
entries: {@i 1st-level Dunes Shaman feature}

Survival in a desert is no easy feat. You must be able to make do with scant resources, and able to avoid the predators and dangers that roam - an upfront approach is rarely your best choice. You gain proficiency in {@item cook's utensils|PHB} and {@skill Stealth}.
Furthermore, you are naturally acclimated to hot or cold temperatures (depending on your desert) when considering {@hazard extreme heat|DMG} or {@hazard extreme cold|DMG}.

subclassFeature.name: Mirage
entries: {@i 1st-level Dunes Shaman feature}

You can channel the power of the changing temperatures in the desert to conjure mirages. When you are targeted by an attack or ability that targets an area (such as a dragon's breath or a {@spell fireball|phb|fireball spell}, you can use your reaction to teleport 5 feet to an unoccupied space in a direction of your choice, potentially avoiding the effect.

subclassFeature.name: Control the Storm
entries: {@i 6th-level Dunes Shaman feature}

Deserts are known for their harsh weather conditions, and you can create some of your own. Once per short rest, you can spend an action to create a storm of swirling particulates in a 15 foot radius around you (this could be snow or sand, for example). This area provides half cover for you and your allies and is difficult terrain for creatures other than you to move through.

subclassFeature.name: Duneswalker
entries: {@i 6th-level Dunes Shaman feature}
You are practised in walking the deserts, and are not affected by difficult terrain consisting of sand, snow, or other similar materials such as fine gravel.

subclassFeature.name: Superior Mirage
entries: {@i 10th-level Dunes Shaman feature}

Your mirage is superior, increasing the distance that it covers. You can teleport up to 10 feet when using your {@subclassFeature Mirage|Shaman|S: Shaman|Dunes|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman|mirage}, and you can spend a spell slot of any level to increase the distance you teleport by a number of feet equal to 10 times the slot level expended.

subclassFeature.name: Liquefaction
entries: {@i 14th-level Dunes Shaman feature}

You have learned much greater control over the desert storms. You can {@status concentration||concentrate} on your {@subclassFeature Control the Storm|Shaman|S: Shaman|Dunes|S: Shaman|6|S: Shaman|storm} when you summon it to increase its power, granting the following benefits.

items: You can use a bonus action to move the storm independently of yourself, up to 20 feet, where the storm then remains until you move it again.
The area is lightly obscured. You and creatures you choose can attempt to hide in this light obscurement.

Hostile creatures entering the storm or starting their turn in it must make a Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 5d8} piercing damage and become {@condition blinded} until the start of their next turn.

entries: You can concentrate on the storm this way once per long rest. If you lose your {@status concentration}, the storm ends and you must complete a short rest to use it again, as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Forests
entries: Forests are a resilient environment, but are more vulnerable to explicit attack than many others. To this end, Shamans of the Forests take on the role of a hunter, personally handling those who would threaten the forests, be that its trees, inhabitants, or plantlife. The power of the forests grants pursuit, recovery and adaptability - Shamans living this way are open to new solutions, working together, and recovering from a setback.

entries.subclassFeature: Home in the Trees|Shaman|S: Shaman|Forests|S: Shaman|1

subclassFeature.name: Forests Shaman Spells
entries: {@i 1st-level Forests Shaman feature}
You always know these spells from the table below once you reach certain levels in this class. You cannot swap these spells out on level up, unlike your normal Shaman spells.

subclassFeature.name: Home in the Trees
entries: {@i 1st-level Forests Shaman feature}

The rampant plant growth in a forested environment provides opportunity, but also cover. You are trained to see past that cover, and make use of plants and herbs available to you. You have proficiency with the {@item Herbalism Kit|PHB} and with the {@skill Perception} skill.
Furthermore, owing to your hunting training, you have proficiency with medium armour. You can choose to replace your starting Leather Armour with Scale Mail instead.

subclassFeature.name: Runeblade
entries: {@i 1st-level Forests Shaman feature}

You can spend one minute to conjure a Runeblade, a weapon forged of primal magic and natural growth - it is as strong as a normal weapon but nonmagical. The weapon can be any with the finesse property, for example, a {@item dagger|PHB}, {@item shortsword|PHB}, {@item scimitar|PHB}, {@item whip|PHB} or {@item rapier|PHB}. You determine its appearance, but it should take on the approximate physical qualities of the weapon you conjured; for example, a whip might be made of vines, or a shortsword from a bark cutting edge. If you conjure a second Runeblade, the first one withers and disappears to dust.

If you possess a magical weapon, you may spend an hour performing a primal ritual to connect with the weapon, which can be done as part of a short rest or attunement. The weapon becomes nonmagical, and your Runeblade takes on its magical properties when conjured. This connection lasts until you choose to end it or replace it with another magical weapon, at which point the magic returns to the original weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Runeblade Invocation
entries: {@i 1st-level Forests Shaman feature}

You can use your primal magic to invoke the runes on your Runeblade. When you take the {@action Attack|PHB} action, you can expend a spell slot of any level to cause the following effects to take place.

items: You gain a +1 bonus to hit and 1d4 additional damage with your Runeblade. The damage is equal to the weapon's type or, if you have the feature, the damage type of your {@classFeature Elemental Affinity|Shaman|S: Shaman|3|S: Shaman|elemental affinity}.
If you expend a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, your Runeblade attacks deal an additional 3 damage per slot level above first.
You activate one of your known Runeblade Invocations, detailed below.

entries: You can choose 3 of the following Runeblade powers to learn, and you learn an additional powers at 6th, 10th and 14th level in this class. When you gain a level in this class, you can replace one power with another from this feature. If a power has a level requirement, you must be at least that level in this class to learn it. If a power requires a saving throw, it uses your Shaman spell save DC. Powers last until the start of the following turn from their activation.

entries.name: Rapid Growth
entries: Your Runeblade has an additional 5ft of reach.

entries.name: Leeching Seed
entries: When you damage an enemy with your Runeblade, you regain hit points equal to the damage dealt by the attack (not including the additional damage from this feature).

entries.name: Deep Foliage
entries: You are surrounded by the leaves of the forest, granting you a +3 bonus to your AC and Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Gust Step
entries: Your movement speed is increased by 20 feet.

entries.name: Razorleaf Edge
entries: Your Runeblade attacks cause targets to {@condition Bleed|Starlight}.

entries.name: Erupting Vines (6th level or higher)
entries: The first time you hit a creature with your Runeblade this turn, it must make a Strength saving throw or become {@condition Restrained} until the start of your next turn.

entries.name: Sporeburst (6th level or higher)
entries: Once, when you hit a creature with your Runeblade, you can force it to make a Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition Dazed|Starlight} until the end of its turn.

entries.name: Hunter's Instinct (10th level or higher)
entries: You gain a further +2 bonus to attack rolls with your Runeblade.

entries.name: Distracting Colouration (10th level or higher)
entries: Your attacks demand attention, or cow your opponents. The first creature you hit with your Runeblade is either {@condition charmed|PHB} by you, or it has disadvantage to attack a creature other than you on its next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: {@i 6th-level Forests Shaman feature}
When you take the {@action Attack|PHB} action on your turn, you can attack twice with your Runeblade instead of once.

subclassFeature.name: Treeswalker
entries: {@i 6th-level Forests Shaman feature}
You are not affected by difficult terrain consisting of plants or similar foliage. If a plant is hazardous, such as being covered in spines, it does not harm you.
For you, the {@spell Plant Growth|PHB} spell only requires you to spend 2 feet per 1 foot of movement.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Runeblade Invocation
entries: {@i 6th-level Forests Shaman feature}
You learn one additional Runeblade Invocation.

subclassFeature.name: Masterful Hunter
entries: {@i 10th-level Forests Shaman feature}
You can {@action Hide|PHB} as a bonus action, and can attempt to do so when you are only lightly obscured. While hidden, your movement speed is increased by 15 feet.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Runeblade Invocation
entries: {@i 10th-level Forests Shaman feature}
You learn one additional Runeblade Invocation.

subclassFeature.name: Empowered Invocation
entries: {@i 14th-level Forests Shaman feature}

A number of times per day equal to your proficiency bonus, you can activate two effects simultaneously when you {@subclassFeature Runeblade Invocation|Shaman|S: Shaman|Forests|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman|invoke your runeblade}.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Runeblade Invocation
entries: {@i 14th-level Forests Shaman feature}
You learn one additional Runeblade Invocation.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Guardian Angel
entries: As a reaction to a friendly creature within 30 feet of you taking damage, you can use your Channel Divinity to protect them, preventing the triggering damage and surrounding them in an invulnerable barrier which gives them resistance to all further damage.
If the protected creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, deals damage to another creature, or forces a creature to make a saving throw, the effect ends.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Rallying Cry
entries: As a bonus action, you hold your weapon or arm aloft and shout a rallying cry, beckoning your allies forward.

You can use your Channel Divinity to choose creatures you can see within 30 feet of you, up to a number equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one creature). Until the end of their next turn, each of those creatures gains a bonus to weapon attack and damage rolls equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one), and an additional 10 feet of movement speed.

subclassFeature.name: Oath Spells
entries: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed in the Oath of Unity Spells table.

entries.caption: Oath of Unity Spells
rows: {@spell Sanctuary}, {@spell Protection from Evil and Good}
{@spell Circle of Power}, {@spell Dispel Evil and Good}

subclassFeature.name: Tenets of Unity
entries: The Oath of unity is a vow taken to protect the ideals of community and the people within it. They seek to protect the people from evil, as the selfish can never truly be united. This often extends to powers and beings from other planes, who would seek to take aspects of the material plane for their own. The imagery of a paladin under this oath may take the shape of wings, as a protector or guardian angel, working together to protect people from the horrors that would tear them and their kingdoms apart.

You may have received your calling during a moment of heroism, or a moment of vulnerability, in the service or protection of others. Or perhaps you heard a voice on the wind, under a full moon. However this oath came to you, you value the safety of others above all, and seek to put down selfishness in all its forms.

entries.name: Community
entries: The people need you. Be their shield.

entries.name: Courage
entries: Bravery is not the absence of fear, but acting in spite of it. Evil prevails when good men do not act - so you should act.

entries.name: Honour
entries: Be fair and just. Your actions are your deeds. Avoid harm, but do not let that get in the way of doing good.

entries.name: Tolerance
entries: Intolerance cannot be tolerated. People may exist as they are, unless they threaten the peace of others. To stay neutral is to side with the oppressor.

entries.name: Integrity
entries: You cannot be responsible for others if you cannot hold yourself to account. Protect those in your care, and ensure that all authority is just.

subclassFeature.name: Aura of Coordination
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your presence provides inspiration to your allies, allowing you to coordinate their movements. Friendly creatures that start their turn 10 feet of you may take the Disengage action as a bonus action on that turn.

subclassFeature.name: Resilient Spirit
entries: Beginning at 15th level, your presence is a stronghold. Each friendly creature within your Aura of Coordination regains hit points equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1) at the start of each of their turns, to a total no higher than your paladin level.

subclassFeature.name: Champion of the People
entries: At 20th level, your presence becomes a terror to enemies who stand against you, and you become a beacon of hope to your allies. As an action, you transform, becoming a shining beacon of unity for your allies to rally around. You may be surrounded by swirling sigils and sparkling moonlight.
During the transformation, you gain the following features for ten minutes:

items: Your aura is filled with bright moonlight.
Your spirit is empowered: friendly creatures within your aura have advantage on wisdom saving throws, and regain the maximum health possible from any healing.

Your resolve is unbreakable: when a friendly creature would be reduced to zero hit points or killed within your aura, they are instead reduced to one hit point. A given creature can benefit from this only once per long rest.
Your form cannot be changed against your will.

entries: Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Conduit
entries: You may add your spellcasting ability modifier to the damage you deal with any cantrip that deals fire, cold, thunder, lightning, or acid damage.

optionalfeature.name: Spirit's Intuition
entries: You learn the {@spell Guidance|PHB} cantrip. It has a duration of ten minutes when you cast it.

optionalfeature.name: Moon's Spirit
entries: You do not need to sleep and cannot be forced to by any means. You can gain a long rest by doing 8 hours of light activity instead of sleeping.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Warrior
entries: You learn the {@spell Shillelagh} cantrip, and when you cast it it lasts for ten minutes and can be applied to any weapon with which you are proficient.

optionalfeature.name: Roots of the Tree
entries: You may add your proficiency bonus to saving throws made to maintain your {@status concentration} on a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Understanding
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with animals} and at will and without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Darkseer
entries: You gain darkvision out to 120 feet, or increase your existing darkvision by 120 feet. Your darkvision makes darkness appear as bright light to you, instead of dim.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Arcana
entries: You can cast {@spell Detect Magic|PHB}, {@spell Detect Evil and Good}, and {@spell Detect Poison and Disease} once per long rest each, without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Lightfeet
entries: You learn the {@spell Longstrider|PHB} and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Jungle's Bounty
entries: You can cast the {@spell Goodberry|PHB} spell once per long rest. When you cast the spell in this way, you create an additional number of berries equal to your proficiency bonus.

optionalfeature.name: Natural Instincts
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Survival} and {@skill Medicine} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Far Sight
entries: As part of an hour-long ritual, you look into the future, sensing a power you might require. You may ask a question about an event to occur within the next 7 days, and the DM may suggest a spell or type of spell that would prove beneficial. You can then swap one spell that you know for another on the Shaman spell list. You may do this only once each {@dice 2d4} days.
{@note The spell you can learn follows normal rules. For example, a 6th level Shaman could learn a 3rd level spell or lower, even if they had 4th level spell slots.}

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Manipulation
entries: You can change the damage type of a spell you cast to the damage type of your Elemental Affinity.

optionalfeature.name: Home at Sea
entries: You gain a swimming speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a swimming speed, this increases it by 10 feet instead.
You also learn the {@spell Water Breathing|PHB} spell, which doesn't count against your known Shaman spells.

optionalfeature.name: Home in the Trees
entries: You gain a climbing speed of 40 feet, or your walking speed, whichever is higher. If you already have a climbing speed, it increases to that amount
You learn the {@spell Spider Climbing} spell and cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Heart
entries: You learn the {@spell Summon Fey|TCE} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Gifts of the Elders
entries: You learn the {@spell Borrowed Knowledge|SCC} and {@spell Enhance Ability|PHB} spells.

optionalfeature.name: Primordial Thorns
entries: Upon taking damage from a creature you can see, or one that is within 5 feet of you, you can spend a reaction to deal {@dice 1d6} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
This damage increases to {@dice 2d6} at 11th level.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Elemental Superiority
entries: When you deal damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity, you ignore resistance to damage of that type.

optionalfeature.name: Druidic Teachings
entries: You learn the {@spell Polymorph} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Aversion
entries: You learn the {@spell Elemental Bane|XGE} spell. Once per long rest, when you cast this spell, you can forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on it by reducing its duration to the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Keeper of the Grove
entries: Once per short rest, you can attempt to allow nature to siphon a creature's magic for a turn.
The target must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, it takes {@dice 3d12} radiant damage and becomes {@condition silenced|S: Conditions} until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Small Friends
entries: You learn the {@spell Insect Plague|PHB} spell. You can communicate with insects freely.

optionalfeature.name: Nature Companion
entries: You can cast the {@spell Find Familiar|PHB} spell once per long rest without expending material components. Your familiar takes the form of a {@creature Sapling Treant|S: Shaman} or a {@creature Raven|MM}.

optionalfeature.name: Forest Walker
entries: You learn the {@spell Transport Via Plants|PHB} spell and can cast it once per long rest without expending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Master of Roots
entries: Once per long rest, you can cast the Grasping vine spell. When you do so, you can either cast the spell as a bonus action, or forgo the need to {@status concentration||concentrate} on the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Command of Air
entries: You can cast the {@spell Fly|PHB} spell at will.

optionalfeature.name: Earthly Intuition
entries: You gain Tremorsense to a range of 30 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Nature's Will
entries: If you cast a spell and miss all of its attack roll(s), or all targets pass their saving throws to resist its effect, you can cast a cantrip as a bonus action instead of an action. You may do this once per short rest.

optionalfeature.name: Searing Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Searing Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which causes creatures to {@condition burning|S: Conditions|burn} on entering the area, or take {@damage 1d4} fire damage if they are already burning.

optionalfeature.name: Roaring Flames
entries: The size of your spells that deal fire damage, if they specify an area, increase by 5 feet when you cast them (for example, {@spell Burning Hands|PHB} increases from a 15-foot cone to a 20-foot cone). If a spell specifies multiple dimensions, such as {@spell Wall of Fire|PHB}, you choose one to increase.

optionalfeature.name: Compound Burns
entries: Your {@b Growing Heat} feature improves. A creature now takes additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus any time they take fire damage, instead of only when you deal it. The effect's duration is still only increased by you.

optionalfeature.name: Glacial Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Glacial Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which, to creatures you choose, makes the area surrounding it difficult terrain and prevents regaining of hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Ice Block
entries: On the turn that you cast a spell of 1st level or higher that deals cold damage to one or more creatures, you can gain temporary hit points equal to your proficiency bonus times the number of creatures you deal cold damage to with that spell.

optionalfeature.name: Absolute Zero
entries: Your {@b Biting Cold} feature is enhanced. The penalty now applies to the next attack roll, ability check, or saving throw that the target makes. It also imposes disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Voltaic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Voltaic Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which prevents creatures of your choice within its area from taking reactions.

optionalfeature.name: Spasming Shocks
entries: Once per round, if you deal lightning damage to a creature by expending a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can cause it to be {@condition staggered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Aftershock
entries: Your {@b Arc Lightning} feature improves. It can now affect up to four targets, and the range limitation of 15 feet is between targets affected by this feature, not the original target.

optionalfeature.name: Booming Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Booming Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which creates a shockwave that pushes creatures of your choosing away from the totem.

optionalfeature.name: Disorienting Thunderclap
entries: Once per turn, when you deal Thunder damage to a creature with a spell of at least 3rd level, it must make a Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone|PHB}.

optionalfeature.name: Reverberating Thunder
entries: Your {@b Thundercrack} feature improves. You are able to push creatures of any size, and the distance increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Caustic Totem
entries: You can summon a {@creature Caustic Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which reduces the AC of creatures of your choice in its area by 2.

optionalfeature.name: Rapid Erosion
entries: When you deal acid damage to a creature with a spell of 1st level or higher, you can force it to make a Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition sundered|S: Conditions} until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Viscous Acid
entries: Your {@b Persistent Corrosion} feature improves. A creature suffering from the effect is {@condition Hampered|S: Conditions} and deals {@damage 1d4} less damage with weapon attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Resilience
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Unwavering Spirit|Shaman|S: Shaman|Mountains|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman|unwavering spirit}, you can grant a creature resistance to the triggering damage alongside your normal reduction. This lasts until the start of their next turn.
You can do this once, and must complete a short or long rest before you can do so again.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Mountains
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|S: Shaman|20|S: Shaman|spiritual avatar} feature, you are resistant to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: High-pressure Jet
entries: Your {@subclassFeature Ebb and Flow|Shaman|S: Shaman|Waters|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman|Ebb and Flow water jet}, also pushes creatures back 5 feet when you hit them with it. At level 14, this increases to 10 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Affinity Jet
entries: When you use your {@subclassFeature Ebb and Flow|Shaman|S: Shaman|Waters|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman|Ebb and Flow water jet}, you can choose to make its damage match your elemental affinity instead of bludgeoning.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Waters
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|S: Shaman|20|S: Shaman|spiritual avatar} feature, you regain 15 hit points at the start of each of your turns.

optionalfeature.name: Empowered Mirage
entries: When using your {@subclassFeature Mirage|Shaman|S: Shaman|Dunes|S: Shaman|1|S: Shaman}, you can deal damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity equal to your proficiency bonus to all other creatures of your choice within 5 feet of the space you left.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Dunes
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|S: Shaman|20|S: Shaman|spiritual avatar} feature, you gain an additional reaction each round.

optionalfeature.name: Avatar of the Forest
entries: When using your {@classFeature Spiritual Avatar|Shaman|S: Shaman|20|S: Shaman|spiritual avatar} feature, you are naturally camouflaged. When taking damage, you can use a reaction to become {@condition Invisible} until the end of your next turn, or until you attack or cast a spell.

optionalfeature.name: Rune of Totem Summoning
entries: You gain the ability to conjure a Nature Spirit Totem. This tiny elemental creature applies an effect to an area within 15 feet of itself. If a totem deals damage, you are considered to have done that damage.

Summoning a totem requires an action, and the totem appears in an unoccupied space within 60 feet of you, and lasts for one minute. Once summoned, you cannot do so again until you complete a long rest or unless you expend a spell slot of first level or higher.

The totem requires your {@status concentration} (as if you were concentrating on a spell), however, you can summon additional totems using the same concentration. Whenever you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain your concentration, you choose one totem to disappear. If you use another effect which requires concentration such as a spell, they all disappear.
You know how to summon two totems from the list below. You can change your selection whenever you gain a level in this class.

items: {@creature Taunting Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Warding Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Warning Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Lifting Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Blessing Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}
{@creature Wrath of Air Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}

optionalfeature.name: Totemkeeper
entries: When expending a spell slot to summon a totem, you may summon two at once if the spell slot expended is of third level or higher.

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Blast
entries: Your totems gain the ability to launch a blast of elemental magic. The blast uses your spell attack modifier, is fired from an active totem using your bonus action, and deals {@damage 1d8+PB} damage of a type matching your elemental affinity.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totemic Might
entries: When you summon a totem, it gains temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Commander
entries: You have greater control over where your totems are summoned. You can summon them in the air, or attached to you or a willing creature.

A totem attached to a creature moves with it, but can still be targeted individually. If attached to a creature, you can expend a reaction to force the totem to be the new target of an attack that would otherwise hit the creature it is attached to.
{@note This ability is listed in the Nature Spirit Totems' statistics.}

optionalfeature.name: Totem Specialist
entries: You learn how to summon two more totems from the list in the {@optfeature Rune of Totem Summoning|S: Shaman}.
Furthermore, your totems become proficient in all saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Enforcement Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Enforcement Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}, which grants creatures of your choice temporary hit points at the start of each of your turns and prevents them from being moved against their will.

optionalfeature.name: Manarage Totem
entries: You learn how to summon a {@creature Manarage Nature Spirit Totem|S: Shaman}. You can summon it once per short rest and it provides the following benefits:

Creatures within the area may cast one first-level spell without expending a spell slot, or use any feature which can be used more than once per short rest, without expending a use of that feature, but no more than once per turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: If the treant is motionless at the start of combat, it has advantage on its initiative roll. Moreover, if a creature hasn't observed the treant move or act, that creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check to discern that the treant is animate.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Taunting Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Hostile creatures within this totem's area have disadvantage on any attack that doesn't target the totem.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

bonus.name: Totemic Blast (Requires Totemic Blast Primordial Rune)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hitYourSpellAttack} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d8+PB} damage of the type associated with your elemental affinity.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Blast|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

reaction.name: Totem Commander
entries: The totem takes the damage of an attack that would hit a creature it is attached to.
{@note} This requires the {@optfeature Totem Commander|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune to use.

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem
entries: The totem cannot take any actions unless its summoner expends the appropriate action to command it to do so.

trait.name: Warning Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.
Once per round, creatures within the area can gain a bonus to one saving throw they make. The bonus is equal to half your spellcasting ability modifier (rounded up).

entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem

trait.name: Warding Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

When a creature hostile to you attempts to enter the totem's area, it must make a {@savingThrow Wisdom} saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition Halted|S: Conditions} until the end of its turn.

trait.name: Totemic Might
entries: Gains temporary hit points equal to twice your PB when summoned.
{@note This requires the {@optfeature Totemic Might|S: Shaman} Primordial Rune.}

trait.name: Nature Spirit Totem

trait.name: Lifting Totem Aura
entries: The totem emits an aura which affects a 15-foot radius sphere centred on itself.

When a friendly creature would enter this totem's area, it can spend an additional 5 feet of movement to be lifted by elemental winds and carried to the opposite side of the area. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.
A friendly creature that starts its turn within the area gains 10 feet of movement speed for that turn.

Once per round, any creature within the totem's area may add their spellcasting ability modifier to one damage roll from an attack or spell. If they do not have a spellcasting ability modifier, they use their Wisdom ability modifier.
